Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on an unreliable source, Natural News, which has a history of publishing false information.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the bill mentioned in the article is still before the Oregon Legislature, when in fact it died in committee in 2017 and a similar bill met the same fate in 2019.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the bill did not specifically single out Monsanto or any other company, despite the emphasis on Monsanto in the headline.
Understate: The claim may understate the current status of Monsanto, as it has been acquired by Bayer and the Monsanto brand name has been dropped.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of exaggeration in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not providing accurate and up-to-date information about the status of the bill and the involvement of Monsanto.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
